layer.name: Agricultural water use (million gallons/day)
layer.eaCategory: Clean and Plentiful Water - Water Supply and Demand - Water Uses
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the millions of gallons of water used daily for agricultural irrigation for each subwatershed (HUC-12) in the contiguous United States. Estimates include self-supplied surface and groundwater, as well as water supplied by irrigation water providers, which may include governments, companies, or other organizations.

layer.name: Acres of crops that have no nearby pollinator habitat
layer.eaCategory: Food, Fuel, and Materials - Pollination and Pest Control - Acres of crops that have no nearby pollinator habitat

fieldInfos.label: Acres of crops that have no nearby pollinator habitat

layer.eaDescription: This map layer depicts the total acres of agricultural crops within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that require or would benefit from the presence of pollinators, but are without any nearby supporting habitat.

layer.name: Area of solar energy (km2)
layer.eaCategory: Food, Fuel, and Materials - Energy Potential - Solar Energy
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the square kilometers of area within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that offers the potential for harvesting solar energy. This map does not take into account land use or ownership.

layer.name: Average annual daily potential (kWh/m2/day)
layer.eaCategory: Food, Fuel, and Materials - Energy Potential - Solar Energy
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the average potential kilowatt hours of solar energy that could be harvested within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC). This calculation is based on environmental factors and does not take into account land ownership or viability of installing solar harvesting systems.

layer.name: Average annual precipitation (inches/yr)
layer.eaCategory: Clean Air - Climate - Precipitation; Clean and Plentiful Water - Climate - Precipitation; Climate Stabilization - Climate - Average annual precipitation; Natural Hazard Mitigation - Climate - Precipitation; Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Climate - Precipitation;
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the average number of inches of precipitation that fall within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) each year. Precipitation includes snow and rain accumulation.

layer.name: Carbon storage by tree biomass (kg/m2)
layer.eaCategory: Climate Stabilization - Carbon Storage - Carbon storage by tree biomass
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the kilograms of dry carbon stored per square meter of above ground biomass of trees and forests  in each subwatershed (12-digit HUC).

layer.name: Carbon storage by tree root biomass (kg/m2)
layer.eaCategory: Climate Stabilization - Carbon Storage - Carbon storage by tree root biomass

fieldInfos.label: Carbon storage by tree root biomass (kg/m2)

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the kilograms of dry carbon stored per square meter in below ground biomass in each subwatershed (12-digit HUC). Biomass below ground includes tree root biomass and soils.

layer.name: Cotton yields (thousand tons/yr)
layer.eaCategory: Food, Fuel, and Materials - Crop Production - Crop Yields
layer.eaDescription: This map depicts the thousands of tons of cotton that are grown annually within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC).

layer.name: Cultivated biological nitrogen fixation (kg N/ha/yr)
layer.eaCategory: Clean Air - Potential Air Stressors - Managed and Developed Land; Climate Stabilization - Land Cover - Managed and Developed;
layer.eaDescription: This map depicts the mean rate of biological nitrogen fixation from the cultivation of crops within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in kg N/ha/yr.

layer.name: Domestic water use (million gallons/day)
layer.eaCategory: Clean and Plentiful Water - Water Supply and Demand - Water Uses
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the millions of gallons of water used daily for domestic purposes in each subwatershed (HUC-12). For the purposes of this map, domestic or residential water use includes all indoor and outdoor uses, such as for drinking, bathing, cleaning, landscaping, and pools for primary residences.

layer.name: Fruit yields (thousand tons/yr)
layer.eaCategory: Food, Fuel, and Materials - Crop Production - Crop Yields
layer.eaDescription: This map depicts the thousands of tons of fruit crops that are grown annually within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC).

layer.name: Grain yields (thousand tons/yr)
layer.eaCategory: Food, Fuel, and Materials - Crop Production - Crop Yields
layer.eaDescription: This map depicts the thousands of tons of major grain crops that are grown annually within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC).

layer.name: Hectares of cotton crops

layer.name: Hectares of fruit crops

G1 and G2 denote Global Conservation Ranks classified by NatureServe.

layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - At Risk Species - Observed At Risk Species; Clean and Plentiful Water - Aquatic Habitat and Biota - Observed At Risk Species; Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Priority Species - Observed At Risk Species

layer.name: Number of dams

layer.eaDescription: This map depicts the number of dams within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC). For this map, EnviroAtlas uses the National Inventory of Dams maintained by the US Army Corps of Engineers.

layer.eaCategory: Food, Fuel, and Materials - Crop Production - Crop Yields

layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Featured Habitat Types - Aquatic Habitat; Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (IUCN Ranks);
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the total number of animal species associated with terrestrial habitat that are listed as G1, G2, or in the federal endangered species program that may reside within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC). G1 and G2 denote Global Conservation Ranks classified by NatureServe. Terrestrial habitat refers to land areas such as forests, grasslands, deserts and rainforests.

layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Featured Habitat Types - Aquatic Habitat; Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (IUCN Ranks);

layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Featured Habitat Types - Aquatic Habitat; Clean and Plentiful Water - Climate - Precipitation; Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (IUCN Ranks)

layer.name: Oxidized nitrogen dry deposition (kg/ha)
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Potential Habitat Stressors - Fragmentation of Habitat Corridors; Clean Air - Climate - Precipitation; Clean and Plentiful Water - Potential Water Stressors - Hydrologic Alteration
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the annual dry deposition of oxidized nitrogen within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in kilograms per hectare. Dry deposition occurs when particles or gases attach to surfaces such as dust or smoke and fall to the earth's surface.

layer.name: Oxidized nitrogen wet deposition (kg/ha)
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Potential Habitat Stressors - Fragmentation of Habitat Corridors; Clean Air - Climate - Precipitation; Clean and Plentiful Water - Potential Water Stressors - Hydrologic Alteration
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the annual wet deposition of oxidized nitrogen within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in kilograms per hectare. Wet deposition occurs when rain, snow, or fog carry nitrogen to the earth’s surface.

layer.name: Percent agriculture on hydric soil
layer.eaCategory: Clean and Plentiful Water - Potential Water Stressors - Annual Atmospheric Deposition; Food, Fuel, and Materials - Land Cover - Vegetated; Natural Hazard Mitigation - Land Cover - Stream and Lake Buffers
layer.eaDescription: This map depicts the percentage of land managed for agriculture that has hydric soils within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC). This includes all land dedicated to the production of crops, but excludes land managed for pasture.

layer.name: Percent agriculture on wet areas (wetness index > 550)
layer.eaCategory: Clean and Plentiful Water - Potential Water Stressors - Annual Atmospheric Deposition; Food, Fuel, and Materials - Land Cover - Vegetated; Natural Hazard Mitigation - Hydrologic Alteration - Number of dams

fieldInfos.label: Percent agriculture on wet areas (wetness index > 550)

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of land within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that is frequently or periodically wet and is managed for agriculture. This map uses a wetness index of 550 to determine if the area is considered to be wet.

layer.name: Percent cropland
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (IUCN Ranks); Clean Air - Potential Human and Ecosystem Exposure - Near Road Environments; Clean and Plentiful Water - Potential Water Stressors - Annual Atmospheric Deposition; Climate Stabilization - Land Cover - Vegetated; Food, Fuel, and Materials - Land Cover - Vegetated; Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Land Cover - Vegetated
layer.eaDescription: This map depicts the percent of land managed as cropland in each subwatershed (12-digit HUC). For this map, EnviroAtlas uses all crop types in the Cropland Data Layer created by the United States Department of Agriculture.

layer.name: Percent developed land on wet areas (wetness index > 550)
layer.eaCategory: Clean and Plentiful Water - Potential Wetland Restoration - Potentially Restorable Wetlands; Natural Hazard Mitigation - Hydrologic Alteration - Number of dams;

fieldInfos.label: Percent developed land on wet areas (wetness index > 550)

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of land within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that is frequently or periodically wet and has been developed or urbanized. This map uses a wetness index of 550 to determine if the area is considered to be wet. This map includes various types of development such as open spaces, parks, golf courses, single family homes, multifamily housing units, retail, commercial, industrial sites, and associated infrastructure.

layer.name: Percent emergent herbaceous wetlands
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Other Priority Species; Clean and Plentiful Water - Natural Filtration - Wet Areas; Food, Fuel, and Materials - Crop Production - Crop Yields; Food, Fuel, and Materials - Pollination and Pest Control - Acres of crops that have no nearby pollinator habitat; Natural Hazard Mitigation - Water Supply - Water supply from reservoirs; Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Priority Species - Modeled Threatened and Endangered Vertebrate Species;
layer.eaDescription: This map depicts the percent of land comprised of emergent herbaceous wetlands in each subwatershed (12-digit HUC). For this map, EnviroAtlas uses the National Land Cover Database and its definition of  emergent herbaceous wetlands.

layer.name: Percent forest
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Other Priority Species; Clean Air - Potential Air Stressors - Managed and Developed Land; Clean and Plentiful Water - Natural Filtration - Wet Areas; Food, Fuel, and Materials - Crop Production - Crop Yields; Food, Fuel, and Materials - Pollination and Pest Control - Acres of crops that have no nearby pollinator habitat; Natural Hazard Mitigation - Water Supply - Water supply from reservoirs; Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Priority Species - Modeled Threatened and Endangered Vertebrate Species
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the percentage of total land within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that is covered by trees and forest.

layer.name: Percent forest and woody wetlands
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Other Priority Species; Clean Air - Potential Air Stressors - Managed and Developed Land; Clean and Plentiful Water - Natural Filtration - Wet Areas; Food, Fuel, and Materials - Crop Production - Crop Yields; Natural Hazard Mitigation - Water Supply - Water supply from reservoirs; Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Priority Species - Modeled Threatened and Endangered Vertebrate Species
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the percentage of total land within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that is covered by trees and forest or woody wetlands. EnviroAtlas uses the National Land Cover Database definition of woody wetlands.

layer.name: Percent forest and woody wetlands in buffer
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Land Cover - Land Cover Diversity; Clean and Plentiful Water - Natural Filtration - Vegetated Land; Natural Hazard Mitigation - Land Cover - Vegetated; Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Harvestable Species - Big Game Species Richness;

fieldInfos.label: Percent forest and woody wetlands in buffer

layer.eaDescription: This map layer portrays the percent of land within 30 meters of streams, rivers, and other hydrologically connected waterbodies within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that is covered by trees and forests or woody wetlands. EnviroAtlas uses the 2006 National Land Cover Database definition of woody wetlands.

layer.name: Percent forest land in buffer
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Land Cover - Land Cover Diversity; Clean and Plentiful Water - Natural Filtration - Vegetated Land; Natural Hazard Mitigation - Land Cover - Vegetated; Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Harvestable Species - Big Game Species Richness;
layer.eaDescription: This map layer portrays the percent of land within 30 meters of streams, rivers, and other hydrologically connected waterbodies within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that is covered by trees and forests.

layer.name: Percent forest on wet areas (wetness index > 550)
layer.eaCategory: Clean and Plentiful Water - Potential Water Stressors - Agricultural Land Management; Natural Hazard Mitigation - Hydrologic Alteration - Number of dams;

fieldInfos.label: Percent forest on wet areas (wetness index > 550)

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of land within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that is frequently or periodically wet and is covered by trees and forests. This map uses a wetness index of 550 to determine if the area is considered to be wet.

layer.name: Percent GAP status 1 and 2
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Wildlife Species Richness - Amphibian Species Richness; Number of fish passage obstructions
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the percent of land within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that is designated as Status 1 or 2 under the USGS Gap Analysis Program. These lands have permanent protections in place limiting visitation, use, and human impacts. Lands with status 1 have more restrictions in place to minimize disturbance and maintain the land's natural state.

layer.name: Percent GAP status 1, 2, and 3
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Wildlife Species Richness - Amphibian Species Richness; Number of fish passage obstructions
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the percent of land within subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that has legally recognized easements for conservation or other protections in place to restrict human use or development. This layer includes both public and private land.

layer.name: Percent GAP status 3
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Wildlife Species Richness - Amphibian Species Richness; Number of fish passage obstructions
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the percent of land within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that is designated as Status 3 under the USGS Gap Analysis Program. These areas have permanent protection from conversion of natural land cover for the majority of area. Subject to extractive uses of either broad, low-intensity type (e.g.. Logging) or localized intense type (e.g.. Mining). Confers protection to federally listed endangered and threatened species throughout the area.

layer.name: Percent impervious area
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (IUCN Ranks); Clean Air - Potential Human and Ecosystem Exposure - Near Road Environments; Clean and Plentiful Water - Potential Wetland Restoration - Potentially Restorable Wetlands; Climate Stabilization - Land Cover - Vegetated; Food, Fuel, and Materials - Land Cover - Vegetated; Natural Hazard Mitigation - Land Cover - Stream and Lake Buffers; Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Land Cover - Vegetated
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the percent of total land within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that is impervious. Impervious surfaces do not allow the penetration of water and include buildings, roads, and sidewalks.

layer.name: Percent IUCN status IA
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks); Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks)
layer.eaDescription: This map portrays the percentage of land within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that has been classified as Status IA by International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN). Category IA protected areas seek to protect biodiversity and natural features; human visitation, use, and impacts are strictly controlled.

layer.name: Percent IUCN status IB
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks); Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks)
layer.eaDescription: This map portrays the percentage of land within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that has been classified as Status IB by International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN). Category IB protected areas include large unmodified or slightly modified areas, without permanent or significant human habitation. These lands are protected and managed so as to protect their natural condition.

layer.name: Percent IUCN status II
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks); Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks)
layer.eaDescription: This map portrays the percentage of land within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that has been classified as Status II by International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN). Category II protected areas are large natural or near natural areas set aside to protect large-scale ecological processes, along with the complement of species and ecosystems characteristic of the area, which also provide a foundation for environmentally and culturally compatible, spiritual, scientific, educational, recreational, and visitor opportunities.

layer.name: Percent IUCN status III
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks); Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks)
layer.eaDescription: This map portrays the percentage of land within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that has been classified as Status III by International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN). Category III protected areas are set aside to protect a specific natural monument, which can be a landform, sea mount, submarine cavern, geological feature such as a cave or even a living feature such as an ancient grove. They are generally quite small protected areas and often have high visitor value.

layer.name: Percent IUCN status IV
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks); Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks)
layer.eaDescription: This map portrays the percentage of land within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that has been classified as Status IV by International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN). Category IV areas aim to protect particular species or habitats and management reflects this priority. Many Category IV protected areas will need regular, active interventions to address the requirements of particular species or to maintain habitats, but this is not a requirement of the category.

layer.name: Percent IUCN status V
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks); Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks)
layer.eaDescription: This map portrays the percentage of land within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that has been classified as Status V by International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN). Category V protected areas have distinct character with significant, ecological, biological, cultural and scenic value: and where safeguarding the integrity of this interaction is vital to protecting and sustaining the area and its associated nature conservation and other values.

layer.name: Percent IUCN status VI
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks); Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks)
layer.eaDescription: This map portrays the percentage of land within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that has been classified as Status VI by International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN). Category VI protected areas are generally large, with most of the area in a natural condition, where a proportion is under sustainable natural resource management and where low-level non-industrial use of natural resources compatible with nature conservation is seen as one of the main aims of the area.

layer.name: Percent land with any IUCN status
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks); Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Protected Lands - Protected Lands (USGS GAP Ranks)

fieldInfos.label: Percent land with any IUCN status

layer.eaDescription: This map portrays the percentage of land within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that is protected. It includes all lands that have been classified by International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) as protected areas.

layer.name: Percent large natural areas
layer.eaCategory: Biodiversity Conservation - Featured Habitat Types - Potentially Restorable Wetlands; Recreation, Culture, and Aesthetics - Featured Habitat Types - Potentially Restorable Wetlands;
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the percent of land within each subwatershed that are covered by large natural areas. Large natural areas are greater than 25,000 acres and covered by forests, shrubs, grasslands, barren land, or wetlands. It excludes areas that are covered by agriculture and developed land.

layer.name: Percent medium natural areas
